page.title: 01HIGH HURSTWOOD GENERAL VIEW
page.content: Lying in an area of Outstanding Natural Beauty to the South West of Crowborough is the village of High Hurstwood with two small neighbouring hamlets Sweethaws and Herons Ghyll. This is mainly farmland and residential country with areas of woodland. From the higher land to the North there are splendid views of the South Downs while the lower levels have a less extensive outlook but enjoy a milder sheltered climate. The A26 crosses the North West corner but most of the roads are narrow and twist at random between hedges and steep banks, following the lines of ancient farm tracks and ill-suited to modern traffic. A network of footpaths enables the public to walk often across otherwise private property.
